choices.A: End users can be identified and tracked across a network.
choices.B: Network performance issues can be identified and automatically remediated.
choices.C: Policies can be updated on multiple devices concurrently, which reduces outage windows.
choices.E: The time that is needed to deploy a change is reduced, compared to manually applying the change.
choices.D: Anomalous network traffic can be detected and correlated.

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of Ansible when managing security platforms? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Add message ID information to the URL string as a parameter.
choices.D: Add message ID information to the headers.
choices.B: Run the script and parse through the returned data to find the desired message.
choices.A: Add message ID information to the URL string as a URI.

discussion.content:
Answer C is correct
GET /sma/api/v2.0/quarantine/messages/details?mid=1755&quarantineType=spam

Retrieving Message Details
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/security_management/sma/sma12-0/api/b_SMA_API_12/test_chapter_010.html#id_91746

choices.C: reporting group with the name blocked_malware

questions.question_text:
The Cisco Security Management Appliance API is used to make a GET call using the URI /sma/api/v2.0/reporting/mail_incoming_traffic_summary/ detected_amp?startDate=2016-09-10T19:00:00.000Z&endDate=2018-09-24T23:00:00.000Z&device_type=esa&device_name=esa01.
What does this GET call return?

choices.C: value of a specific counter from a counter group, with the device name and type for web
choices.B: value of a specific counter from a counter group, with the device name and type for email
choices.D: values of all counters of a counter group, with the device group name and device type for email
choices.A: values of all counters of a counter group, with the device group name and device type for web

discussion.content: Correct answer is B because ESA - *email* security appliance

I think correct answer is B.
Because 'This example shows a query to retrieve the value of a "specific counter" from a counter group, with the device name and type.' in https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/security_management/sma/sma12-0/api/b_SMA_API_12/test_chapter_010.html

Correct answer is C
This example shows a query to retrieve the value of a specific counter from a counter group, with the device name and type.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/security_management/sma/sma12-0/api/b_SMA_API_12/test_chapter_010.html
